info.title: XiVO Confd
info.description:
Confd exposes an API for managing core resources on a XiVO server such as users, extensions, devices, voicemails, queues, etc. Resources can be associated together to provide additional functionality. For example: By associating a voicemail with a user, calls will automatically fallback on to the voicemail when the user cannot answer.

Implementation notes
====================

Errors
------

Responses containing errors will have a status code in the 400 or 500 class. A list of error messages will be returned in the body of the response as a JSON-encoded array:

~~~
[
    "Input error - User not found",
    "Resource error - User not associated to a line"
]
~~~


Updating resources via PUT
--------------------------

When updating a resource, all fields become optional. In other words, only values that have been changed need to be sent to the server. Please note that this behavior may change in future versions of the API.

get.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.call_logs.read`

List call logs in CSV format:

"Call Date","Caller","Called","Period","user Field"

Field names are listed on the first line.

Call Date: Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS

Period: number of seconds of the call. Default: 0 if not answered

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.devices.{device_id}.delete`

A device can not be deleted if it is linked to a line. You must dissociate the line and the device first.

get.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.devices.{device_id}.autoprov.read`

Resets a device into ‘autoprov’ mode. Once in autoprov, a device can be reprovisionned using another provisioning code. The device’s configuration will be lost when reset to autoprov mode.

**Required ACL:** `confd.devices.{device_id}.synchronize.read`

Synchronize a device’s configuration. Used when a configuration has been modified and the changes need to be sent to the device.

get.summary: Get Line associated to Custom endpoint

200.description: Association between Custom Endpoint and Line

get.summary: Get Line associated to SCCP endpoint

200.description: Association between SCCP Endpoint and Line

get.summary: Get Line associated to SIP endpoint

200.description: Association between SIP Endpoint and Line

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter extensions of a certain type. Internal: Used for calling a line with an internal number (e.g. “1000@default”). Incall: Used for calling a line from the outside (e.g. “from-extern” with a DID)

post.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.extensions.create`

The extension number must be included in one of the extension ranges for the given context.

put.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.extensions.{extension_id}.update`

The new extension number must be included in one of the extension ranges for the new context.

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.extensions.{extension_id}.delete`

An extension can not be deleted if it is associated to a line. You must delete the association first.

get.summary: List of possible func key destinations and their parameters

post.summary: Create a template of func keys

get.summary: Get a func key inside template

put.summary: Add/Replace a func key in a template

get.summary: Get Custom endpoint associated to Line

200.description: Association between Line and Custom Endpoint

get.summary: Get SCCP endpoint associated to Line

200.description: Association between Line and SCCP Endpoint

get.summary: Get SIP endpoint associated to Line

200.description: Association between Line and SIP Endpoint

post.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.lines.{line_id}.extensions.create`

Because of technical limitations, a line can only have a single ‘internal’ extension associated (i.e. an extension with a context of type ‘internal’)

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.lines.{line_id}.extensions.{extension_id}.delete`

Any devices that are attached to a line must be removed before dissociating an extension from its line. A device can be dissociated by resetting it to autoprov mode.

**Required ACL:** `confd.callpermissions.{callpermission_id}.delete`

. The call permission will also be removed from all users, groups, incoming calls and outgoing calls.

get.summary: Get users associated to call permission

post.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.queues.{queue_id}.members.agents.create`

Position in queue is set to max position + 1 or 0 if it is the first member of the queue

put.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.users.{user_id}.update`

If the firstname or the lastname is modified, the name of associated voicemail is also updated.

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.users.{user_id}.delete`

A user can not be deleted if he is associated to a line or a voicemail. Any line or voicemail attached to the user must be dissociated first. The user will also be removed from all queues, groups or other XiVO entities whom he is member.

get.summary: Mass export users and associated resources
get.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.users.export.read`

CSV field list available at http://documentation.xivo.io/en/stable/administration/users/csv_import.html

externalDocs.description: Complete documentation on the CSV data format and fields

post.summary: Mass import users and associated resources
post.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.users.import.create`

CSV field list available at http://documentation.xivo.io/en/stable/administration/users/csv_import.html

externalDocs.description: Complete documentation on the CSV data format and fields

**Required ACL:** `confd.users.import.update`

CSV field list available at http://documentation.xivo.io/en/stable/administration/users/csv_import.html

externalDocs.description: Complete documentation on the CSV data format and fields

get.summary: Get call permissions associated to user

Update a forward for a user

Get a func key for a user

get.summary: List funckey templates associated to user

delete.summary: Dissociate a func key template to a user

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.users.{user_id}.lines.{line_id}.delete`

Any devices that are attached the line must be removed before dissociating a user from its line. A device can be dissociated be resetting it to autoprov mode.

get.summary: Get SIP endpoint of main line for a user

200.description: SIP endpoint of main line for a user

get.summary: Get status of all user's services

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.voicemails.{voicemail_id}.delete`

A voicemail can not be deleted if it is still attached to a user. The user must be dissociated first. Any extension that redirects to the voicemail (e.g. an Incoming call) will be disabled after deletion.

get.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.switchboards.{switchboard_id}.stats.read`

Switchboard statistics in CSV format: `"date","entered","answered","transferred","abandoned","forwarded","waiting_time_average"`

Field names are listed on the first line.

date: Formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

waiting_time_average: Formatted as MM:SS.

delete.description:
**Required ACL:** `confd.#`

A SIP line can not be deleted if it is still associated with a user, an extesion, or a device. Any user, extension, or device attached to the line must be dissociated first.

direction.name: direction
direction.description: Sort list of items in 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending) order

enddate.name: end_date
enddate.description: filter before end date. Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS. Empty means 'until the current time'.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to return in the list

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Number of items to skip over in the list. Useful for pagination.

order.name: order
order.description: Name of the field to use for sorting the list of items returned.

search.name: search
search.description: Search term for filtering a list of items. Only items with a field containing the search term will be returned.

startdate.name: start_date
startdate.description: filter after start date. Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS. Empty means 'since the earliest'.

view.name: view
view.description: Different view of the list of users.

GenericError.description: An error occured during the operation

CreateError.description: An error occured when creating the resource

UpdateError.description: An error occured when updating the resource

DeleteError.description: An error occured when deleting the resource

NotFoundError.description: The resource requested was not found on the server

AgentQueue.title: AgentQueue
AgentQueue.description: An association between an agent and a queue. Agents associated to a Queue will receive calls when they are logged in.

penalty.description: Agent's penalty. A priority used for distributing calls.

CallLog.title: CallLog
CallLog.description: Call log in CSV format: "Call Date","Caller","Called","Period","user Field"

plugin.description: Provisioning plugin to be used by device

status.description: Device status. autoprov: Device can be provisionned using a provisioning code, configured: Device is configured and ready to be used, not_configured : Device has not been completely configured

template_id.description: ID of the device template. All device using a device template will have a certain number of common parameters preconfigured for the device

switchboard.description: Indicate if this device is a switchboard

enabled.description: Endpoint can be used when it is enabled

host.description: Hosts that are allowed to use this SIP account

options.description:
Advanced configuration options. Options are appended at the end of a 
SIP account in the file 'sip.conf' used by asterisk.
Please consult the asterisk documentation for further details on available
parameters. Because of database limitations, the following options can only be configured once:

 * md5secret
 * language
 * accountcode
 * amaflags
 * allowtransfer
 * fromuser
 * fromdomain
 * subscribemwi
 * buggymwi
 * call-limit
 * callerid
 * fullname
 * cid_number
 * maxcallbitrate
 * insecure
 * nat
 * promiscredir
 * usereqphone
 * videosupport
 * trustrpid
 * sendrpid
 * allowsubscribe
 * allowoverlap
 * dtmfmode
 * rfc2833compensate
 * qualify
 * g726nonstandard
 * disallow
 * allow
 * autoframing
 * mohinterpret
 * useclientcode
 * progressinband
 * t38pt_udptl
 * t38pt_usertpsource
 * rtptimeout
 * rtpholdtimeout
 * rtpkeepalive
 * deny
 * permit
 * defaultip
 * port
 * regexten
 * subscribecontext
 * fullcontact
 * vmexten
 * callingpres
 * ipaddr
 * regseconds
 * regserver
 * lastms
 * parkinglot
 * protocol
 * outboundproxy
 * transport
 * remotesecret
 * directmedia
 * callcounter
 * busylevel
 * ignoresdpversion
 * session-timers
 * session-expires
 * session-minse
 * session-refresher
 * callbackextension
 * registertrying
 * timert1
 * timerb
 * qualifyfreq
 * contactpermit
 * contactdeny
 * unsolicited_mailbox
 * use_q850_reason
 * encryption
 * snom_aoc_enabled
 * maxforwards
 * disallowed_methods
 * textsupport

Any other options may be repeated as many times as needed. Options must have the following form:

```
{
  "options": [
    ["name1", "value1"],
    ["name2", "value2"]
  ]
}
```

The resulting configuration in sip.conf will have the following form:

```
[sipusername]
context=default
secret=sipsecret
name1=value1
name2=value2
```

Advanced configuration options. Options are appended at the end of a 
SCCP account in the file 'sccp.conf' used by asterisk.
Please consult the asterisk documentation for further details on available
parameters. Because of database limitations, only the following options are allowed:

 * cid_name
 * cid_num
 * allow
 * disallow
 
Options must have the following the form:

```
{
  "options": [
    ["name1", "value1"],
    ["name2", "value2"]
  ]
}
```

The resulting configuration in sip.conf will have the following form:

```
[1000]
name1=value1
name2=value2
```

commented.description: If True the extension is disabled

collection.description: URL towards a collection of entities representing possible values as a destination

values.description: Array of values to choose from for this parameter

FuncKeyDestinationItems.title: FuncKeyDestinationItems
FuncKeyDestinationItems.description: Description of func key destinations and their parameters

context.description: The name of an internal context

device_id.description: ID of the device associated to the line

provisioning_extension.description: Code used to provision a device

provisioning_code.description: Code used to provision a device

registrar.description: Name of the template line used by the device

context.description: The name of an internal context

provisioning_code.description: Code used to provision a device

registrar.description: Name of the template line used by the device

endpoint.description: Type of endpoint (either SIP or SCCP)

callerid.description: Caller id that appears on a phone when calling. Formatted as "Firstname Lastname" < number >

context.description: Context used to emit a call

provisioning_extension.description: Code used to provision a device

id.description: The id of the call permission

name.description: The name of the call permission

password.description: The password to be able to call extensions

mode.description: Determine how the call permission are applied

enabled.description: Disable or enable the call permission

description.description: Additional information about the call permission

extensions.description: Extensions to apply the call permission

uuid.description: User UUID. This ID is globally unique across multiple XiVO instances

call_record_enabled.description: Record all calls made by this user

online_call_record_enabled.description: Allow user to record a call by pressing *3

caller_id.description: Name that appears on the phone when calling. Formatted as "Firstname Lastname" < number >

outgoing_caller_id.description: Name that appears on the phone when calling

mobile_phone_number.description: Phone number for the user’s mobile device

username.description: Username for connecting to the CTI

password.description: Password for connecting to the CTI

music_on_hold.description: Name of the MOH category to use for music on hold

ring_seconds.description: Number of seconds a user's phone will ring before fallbacking

simultaneous_calls.description: Number of allowed simultaneous calls on a user's phone

supervision_enabled.description: Activate presence sharing in the xivo client

preprocess_subroutine.description: Name of the subroutine to execute in asterisk before receiving a call

userfield.description: A custom field which purpose is left to the client. If the user has no userfield, then this field is an empty string.

call_permission_password.description: Overwrite all passwords set in call permissions associated to the user

incall_extension_id.description: ID of the Extension used for incoming calls

row_number.description: Line number corresponding to the CSV data

incall_extension_id.description: ID of the Extension used for incoming calls

row_number.description: Line number corresponding to the CSV data

UserImportError.title: UserImportError
UserImportError.description: List of errors that occured during import

timestamp.description: Time at which the error occured

row_number.description: Line number corresponding to the CSV data

row.description: Original data that caused the error

main_line.description: To be implemented later. Always true

main_user.description: True if the user is the first to have been associated to the line

UserFuncKeyTemplate.title: UserFuncKeyTemplate
UserFuncKeyTemplate.description: Association between a User and a FuncKey Template

password.description: Numeric password used to access the voicemail

email.description: Email address. Notifications and audio attachements will be sent to this address

pager.description: Email address. Summarized notifications will be sent to this address

language.description: Language used for the voicemail menu prompt

timezone.description: Timezone used for announcing at what time a message was recorded

max_messages.description: Maximum number of messages to store

attach_audio.description: Attach an audio file of the recorded message when sending an email

delete_messages.description: Delete messages once they have been listened to

ask_password.description: Ask for password when accessing the voicemail menu

enabled.description: Voicemail can be used when it is enabled

options.description:
Advanced configuration options. Options are appended at the end of a 
voicemail line in the file 'voicemail.conf' used by asterisk.
Please consult the asterisk documentation for further details on available
parameters. Options must have the following the form:

```
{
  "options": [
    ["name1", "value1"],
    ["name2", "value2"]
  ]
}
```

The resulting configuration in voicemail.conf will have the following form:

```
1000 => ,Firstname Lastname,,,name1=value1|name2=value2
```
